page.title: 12WORMHILL FARM MUSEUM
page.content: Wormhill Farm is a{175 acre}holding. The farm has been in the Johnson family for over 50 years.{Mr John {Johnson,}the present owner,decided to collect old machinery over 20 years ago.Today he has over{30 horse drawn {ploughs}the oldest dating to{1710.} Much of the restoration work has been done in his own workshop,Mr Johnson having to learn the art of wheelmaking from a local wheelwright. There is a large collection of other machinery,household articles and early farm tools. In 1980 the Museum was opened to the public and the money raised is given to the{Hereford College for the Blind} to help purchase something useful for the visually handicapped. {
